title: Centuria ups ante on Brisbane office market
text:
Centuria has upped its stakes on Brisbane's office market recovery with the purchase of a commercial building on the city's CBD fringe, for $65.4 million.

The A-grade property at 25 Montpelier Road in Bowen Hills, which was bought through its unlisted Diversified Property Fund. is the latest addition to the fund manager's holdings in Brisbane, which has strong expectations for growth to "ramp up in the next six to 12 months".

St Vincent's Health Australia has committed to the third floor of the A-grade office building at 25 Montpelier Road in Bowen Hills. Supplied

The property, which was sold through JLL's Seb Turnbull and Luke Billiau, has a net lettable area of 7739sq m and is completely leased with a six-year weighted average lease expiry.

Centuria’s joint chief executive, Jason Huljich, said Brisbane markets were steadily improving and yields would continue to compress.

"Vacancy rates are falling, net absorption is up, and this means that effective rental growth is very likely to follow, particularly as infrastructure projects currently in the works start to come online,” Mr Huljich said.
description: Centuria has purchased a commercial building on the city's CBD fringe, for $65.4 million.
